definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
"house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: Now television and radio don't stop reporting the earthquake news.
sentences.chinese: 现在电视广播不停地报道地震新闻。

sentences.english: They hyped up the crowd with TV to sell their political policy.
sentences.chinese: 他们利用电视广播向群众大力兜售他们的政策。

sentences.english: PTV , also known as network TV, is based on IP protocol television services.
sentences.chinese: 也叫网络电视，是指基于IP协议的电视广播服务。

sentences.english: Finally, the paper explains the difference between the point-to-multipoint television broadcasting and the interactive television communication.
sentences.chinese: 最后解释多点电视广播和交互电视通信的区别。

sentences.english: TV broadcasts here are still being done in analogue.
sentences.chinese: 这里的电视广播依然使用的是模拟信号。

sentences.english: The event will be telecast simultaneously to nearly 150 cities.
sentences.chinese: 这一盛事将向近150个城市同时进行电视广播。

sentences.english: The three main mayoral candidates took part in the debate, to be broadcast on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 在星期二，三位市长竞选人参加了电视广播辩论会。

sentences.english: South Korean media, however, criticized the broadcast as stage-managed.
sentences.chinese: 韩国媒体批评这次电视广播犹如表演。

definition: broadcast/CL:個|个[ge4]/broadcasting/to broadcast/(formal) to propagate/to publicize
